Class CharactersInPlay

java.lang.Object
  CharactersInPlay

public class CharactersInPlay
extends java.lang.Object

a program to determine the characters in one of Shakespeare’s plays that have the most speaking parts. .

Version:
(V 0.0.1 30/10/2016)
Author:
(Murat Aka)

 void update(java.lang.String person)

charactersWithNumParts

public void charactersWithNumParts(int num1,
                                   int num2)
determine character names from their counts.

Parameters:
num1 - count greater than this number
num2 - count less than this number

findAllCharacters

public void findAllCharacters()
opens a file, and reads the file line-by-line. For each line, if there is a period on the line, extract the possible name of the speaking part

tester

public void tester()
finds out if the program works

update

public void update(java.lang.String person)
updates the character’s name if it is not already there, and counting this line as one speaking part for this person

Parameters:
person - the input line to be the persons name.
